TUESDAY Oct PERIOD   HealthDay News  A proposed rule from federal regulators that would ban menthol cigarettes and flavored cigars has been sent to the White House Office of Management and Budget for final review PERIOD

The U.S PERIOD Food and Drug Administration first announced the proposed rule in April PERIOD The agency said then that the rule had  reduce  and increase the numbers of smokers who quit PERIOD

 ALA President and CEO Harold Wimmer said in a statement PERIOD 

While the numbers of smokers have dropped the numbers of those who smoke menthols have increased according to the U.S PERIOD Centers for Disease Control and Prevention PERIOD The menthol flavor is appealing to new smokers making cigarettes more addictive according to scientists PERIOD It has also been blamed for health disparities in smoking PERIOD About  percent of all adult smokers smoked menthols but more than  percent of Black smokers did so according to a  study PERIOD Only  percent of White smokers smoke menthols PERIOD

States have been enacting their own menthol bans specifically Massachusetts in  and California in  CNN reported PERIOD Meanwhile tobacco companies have already created a potential workaround to any menthol ban formulating a synthetic menthollike cooling agent and then marketing those products to menthol smokers PERIOD A study published last week revealed that some of these brands are providing even more cooling than actual menthol PERIOD

Still the final rule may incorporate language that addresses that issue also PERIOD  Erika Sward assistant vice president of national advocacy with the ALA told CNN PERIOD
